meanings.definition: In a shy or fearful manner
meanings.sent1: She spoke timidly to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The child approached the new dog timidly.
meanings.sent3: Timidly, the mouse peeked out from its hole.
meanings.sent4: The flower timidly bloomed in the shade.
meanings.sent5: The student timidly raised their hand in class.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of courage or confidence
meanings.sent1: He made a timidly small request.
meanings.sent2: The timidly kitten hid under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The timidly puppy was afraid of its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The timidly bird stayed close to its nest.
meanings.sent5: The timidly explorer hesitated at the cave entrance.
